revised_title: Hoxne Interglacial: A Study of Quaternary Deposits and Paleobotany
tldr: The authors investigated the Quaternary deposits at Hoxne, Suffolk, and studied the plant remains and pollen diagrams from the interglacial sediments. They identified four major vegetational stages and determined that the Hoxne Interglacial is of Great (Elster/Saale, Mindel/Riss) Interglacial age. The study provides insights into the vegetational and climatic history of the interglacial period between the Lowestoft and Gipping Glaciations.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Quaternary geology
